cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW across Hispaniola, forecast to cross Cuba Sunday–Monday, then turn northwest-to-north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the northwest Gulf Coast (south-central Louisiana vicinity) by mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (near Lake Charles/Cameron area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coast from the upper Texas-Louisiana border eastward to Mississippi/Alabama expected to receive the primary impacts; Texas middle coast including Calhoun Port currently outside main impact zone.
weather_observation.wind: Outer rain-bands may bring occasional gusts 20–30 mph late Wed into early Thu.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge around 1–2 ft possible if Laura tracks farther west, but currently expected to remain below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered squalls could drop 1–3 inches of rain; totals above 4 inches are not anticipated with current track.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated beyond minor marine/sea-state deterioration along the middle Texas coast.
